intro: Sericandra pennata, commonly known as the featherleaf sericandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Sericandra pennata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
